titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Walther F. Goebel papers, Rockefeller University Faculty FA162
titlestmt.author: TJ

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-11-01 01:21:06 -0400.

did.unittitle: Walther F. Goebel papers, Rockefeller University Faculty

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Dr. Goebel (1899-) a biochemist, dedicated his time and energy to the study of the body's chemical defense against infection by microorganisms. He joined the Rockefeller Institute as research assistant, 1924-1927, associate, 1927-1934, associate member, 1934-1944, member, 1944-1957, and professor, 1957-1970. He became professor emeritus of the Rockefeller University in 1970.

Professor Goebel received the Avery-Landsteiner Prize of the European Society of Immunologists, in 1973 and honorary doctor of science degrees from Middleburry College, Vermont, in 1959 and the Rockefeller University, in 1978.
Goebel was born on December 24, 1899 in Palo Alto, California. He received a Ph.D. degree from the University of Illinois in 1923 and served there as a scholar in Chemistry from 1920-1921.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Walter Frederick Goebel papers consist of laboratory notebooks, seminars, printed materials, reprints, and minutes of meeting.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted pending permission from Rockefeller University.
